text: Which polygons can be used to tile a surface? Explain why they tile. Give some examples of how tiling polygons can be useful.

Polygons either of the exact same shape or mixed with other shapes such that they fit together to form 360Â° can be used to tile a surface.

Tiling (or tessellation) of shapes is possible because they fit into each other without any gaps or overlaps.

Bees could use triangles, quadrilaterals, or hexagons for their hives. Hexagons give them more area for storage. Some examples of how tiling polygons are useful might include covering a ceiling with tiles, covering a floor with ceramic shapes, and making a repetitive design for an artistic effect on a wall or in the background of a logo.
